oneOf.markdownDescription: A reference to a job defined elsewhere in the configuration, either in the `jobs` section or from an orb (e.g., `my-job` or `orb-name/job-name`).

https://circleci.com/docs/creating-orbs#creating-inline-orbs

Inline orbs can be handy during development of an orb or as a convenience for name-spacing jobs and commands in lengthy configurations, particularly if you later intend to share the orb with others.

type.markdownDescription: The job type. If not specified, defaults to build.

plan_name.markdownDescription: Required plan name for release jobs.

then.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/reference/configuration-reference/#job-type

Approval/no-op jobs primarily act as workflow markers. Other keys like `steps:` are permitted but will be ignored in the final pipeline.

if.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/reference/configuration-reference/#job-type

A build job. The job explicitly has type 'build' or defaults to build when no type specified.

then.markdownDescription: Validation: The job must adhere to the structure of a build job.

type.markdownDescription: The job type. If not specified, defaults to build.

parallelism.markdownDescription: A integer or a parameter evaluating to a integer

oneOf.markdownDescription: A map of environment variable names and values.
An array of strings in the form KEY=VALUE
The value should be a string, but we allow null, boolean and numbers too. Examples: `FOO: true` and `BAR: 2` `BAZ:`

working_directory.markdownDescription: In which directory to run the steps. (default: `~/project`. `project` is a literal string, not the name of the project.) You can also refer the directory with `$CIRCLE_WORKING_DIRECTORY` environment variable.

circleci_ip_ranges.markdownDescription: Enable running jobs with a set of well-defined IP address ranges.

machine.markdownDescription: Use the default machine executor image

enabled.markdownDescription: A boolean or a template parameter evaluating to a boolean

docker_layer_caching.markdownDescription: Set to `true` to enable [Docker Layer Caching](https://circleci.com/docs/docker-layer-caching). Note: If you haven't already, you must open a support ticket to have a CircleCI Sales representative contact you about enabling this feature on your account for an additional fee.

oneOf.markdownDescription: A map of environment variable names and values.
An array of strings in the form KEY=VALUE
The value should be a string, but we allow null, boolean and numbers too. Examples: `FOO: true` and `BAR: 2` `BAZ:`

https://circleci.com/docs/reference/reusing-config/#executor

The name of the executor to use (defined via the top level executors map or from an orb).
Executor stanza to use for the job, with optional parameter overrides.

anyOf.markdownDescription: A job that uses an executor defined elsewhere in the configuration.

jobs.markdownDescription: Jobs are collections of steps. All of the steps in the job are executed in a single unit, either within a fresh container or VM.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Command may be a string reference to another command
A map of environment variable names and values.
An array of strings in the form KEY=VALUE
The value should be a string, but we allow null, boolean and numbers too. Examples: `FOO: true` and `BAR: 2` `BAZ:`

machine.markdownDescription: Use the default machine executor image

oneOf.markdownDescription:
Specify an image tag.

Using CircleCI Cloud? Use of `machine: true` is deprecated. You must specify an image to use.

enabled.markdownDescription: A boolean or a template parameter evaluating to a boolean

docker_layer_caching.markdownDescription: Set to `true` to enable [Docker Layer Caching](https://circleci.com/docs/docker-layer-caching). Note: If you haven't already, you must open a support ticket to have a CircleCI Sales representative contact you about enabling this feature on your account for an additional fee.

oneOf.markdownDescription: A map of environment variable names and values.
An array of strings in the form KEY=VALUE
The value should be a string, but we allow null, boolean and numbers too. Examples: `FOO: true` and `BAR: 2` `BAZ:`
Executor may be a string reference to another executor
A map of environment variable names and values.
An array of strings in the form KEY=VALUE
The value should be a string, but we allow null, boolean and numbers too. Examples: `FOO: true` and `BAR: 2` `BAZ:`

https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#logic-statements

A value or parameter reference to be used in a logical statement.

https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#logic-statements

A logical operator (and, or, not, equal, matches) to be used in dynamic configuration.
A custom logic object with user-defined properties for conditional evaluation.
A reference to a command or built-in step (e.g., `checkout`, `my-command`, or `orb-name/command-name`).
long form commands like `run:` or `checkout:

https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#the-when-step-requires-version-21

A conditional step (`when` or `unless`) that runs based on a logical condition.

executors.markdownDescription: Executors define the environment in which the steps of a job will be run, allowing you to reuse a single executor definition across multiple jobs.

xcode.markdownDescription: The version of Xcode that is installed on the virtual machine, see the [Supported Xcode Versions section of the Testing iOS](https://circleci.com/docs/testing-ios#supported-xcode-versions) document for the complete list.

resource_class.markdownDescription: Amount of CPU and RAM allocated to each container in a job. Note: A performance plan is required to access this feature.

image.markdownDescription: The name of a custom docker image to use

name.markdownDescription: The name the container is reachable by. By default, container services are accessible through `localhost`

entrypoint.markdownDescription: The command used as executable when launching the container

command.markdownDescription: The command used as pid 1 (or args for entrypoint) when launching the container

user.markdownDescription: Which user to run the command as

oneOf.markdownDescription: A map of environment variable names and values.
An array of strings in the form KEY=VALUE
The value should be a string, but we allow null, boolean and numbers too. Examples: `FOO: true` and `BAR: 2` `BAZ:`

aws_auth.markdownDescription: Authentication for AWS EC2 Container Registry (ECR). You can use the access/secret keys or OIDC.

auth.markdownDescription: Authentication for registries using standard `docker login` credentials

working_directory.markdownDescription: In which directory to run the steps.

machine.markdownDescription: Use the default machine executor image

oneOf.markdownDescription:
Specify an image tag.

Using CircleCI Cloud? Use of `machine: true` is deprecated. You must specify an image to use.

enabled.markdownDescription: A boolean or a template parameter evaluating to a boolean

image.markdownDescription: The VM image to use. View [available images](https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#available-machine-images). **Note:** This key is **not** supported on the installable CircleCI. For information about customizing machine executor images on CircleCI installed on your servers, see our [VM provisioner documentation](https://circleci.com/docs/server-admin/latest/operator/manage-virtual-machines-with-machine-provisioner/).

docker_layer_caching.markdownDescription: Set to `true` to enable [Docker Layer Caching](https://circleci.com/docs/docker-layer-caching). Note: If you haven't already, you must open a support ticket to have a CircleCI Sales representative contact you about enabling this feature on your account for an additional fee.

oneOf.markdownDescription: A map of environment variable names and values.
An array of strings in the form KEY=VALUE
The value should be a string, but we allow null, boolean and numbers too. Examples: `FOO: true` and `BAR: 2` `BAZ:`

shell.markdownDescription: Shell to use for execution command in all steps. Can be overridden by shell in each step (default: See [Default Shell Options](https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#default-shell-options)

oneOf.markdownDescription: Executor may be a string reference to another executor

version.markdownDescription: The Workflows `version` field is used to issue warnings for deprecation or breaking changes during v2 Beta. It is deprecated as of CircleCI v2.1

only.markdownDescription: Either a single branch specifier, or a list of branch specifiers

ignore.markdownDescription: Either a single branch specifier, or a list of branch specifiers

branches.markdownDescription: A map defining rules for execution on specific branches

filters.markdownDescription: A map defining rules for execution on specific branches

schedule.markdownDescription: A workflow may have a schedule indicating it runs at a certain time, for example a nightly build that runs every day at 12am UTC:

triggers.markdownDescription: Specifies which triggers will cause this workflow to be executed. Default behavior is to trigger the workflow when pushing to a branch.

max_auto_reruns.markdownDescription: The maximum number of times a workflow will be automatically rerun if it fails

when.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#the-when-step-requires-version-21

Conditional step to run on custom conditions (determined at config-compile time) that are checked before a workflow runs

unless.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#the-when-step-requires-version-21

Conditional step to run when custom conditions aren't met (determined at config-compile time) that are checked before a workflow runs

requires.markdownDescription: Jobs are run in parallel by default, so you must explicitly require any dependencies by their job name.

filters.markdownDescription: This is similar to to other `filters` in config, but has an additional key, `tags`

only.markdownDescription: Either a single branch specifier, or a list of branch specifiers

ignore.markdownDescription: Either a single branch specifier, or a list of branch specifiers

tags.markdownDescription: A map defining rules for execution on specific branches

context.markdownDescription: Either a single context name, or a list of contexts. The default name is `org-global`

parameters.markdownDescription: A map of parameter names to every value the job should be called with

exclude.markdownDescription: A list of argument maps that should be excluded from the matrix

alias.markdownDescription: An alias for the matrix, usable from another job's requires stanza. Defaults to the name of the job being executed

matrix.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#matrix-requires-version-21

The matrix stanza allows you to run a parameterized job multiple times with different arguments.

not.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#logic-statements 

Logical not: true when statement is false

workflows.markdownDescription: Used for orchestrating all jobs. Each workflow consists of the workflow name as a key and a map as a value

jobs.markdownDescription: Jobs are collections of steps. All of the steps in the job are executed in a single unit, either within a fresh container or VM.

orbs.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#orbs-requires-version-21

Orbs are reusable packages of CircleCI configuration that you may share across projects, enabling you to create encapsulated, parameterized commands, jobs, and executors that can be used across multiple projects.

jobs.markdownDescription: Jobs are collections of steps. All of the steps in the job are executed in a single unit, either within a fresh container or VM.

commands.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/configuration-reference#commands-requires-version-21

A command definition defines a sequence of steps as a map to be executed in a job, enabling you to reuse a single command definition across multiple jobs.

steps.markdownDescription: A sequence of steps run inside the calling job of the command.

oneOf.markdownDescription:
https://circleci.com/docs/creating-orbs#creating-inline-orbs

Inline orbs can be handy during development of an orb or as a convenience for name-spacing jobs and commands in lengthy configurations, particularly if you later intend to share the orb with others.

version.markdownDescription: The version field is intended to be used in order to issue warnings for deprecation or breaking changes.
